website_summaries.verdict: When it comes to dog beds, proper ventilation and cooling is as important as heat retention and support. The Coolaroo Elevated Pet Bed serves many purposes for dogs at a remarkably low price point.
pros: The steel frame's rubber feet keep this pet cot stable on floors
Elevation and a breathable material improve air circulation and cooling
Remains supportive for years, unlike foam mattresses
cons: Fabric may trigger a dog's chewing or scratching instincts
Some dogs choose not to use this style of elevated "trampoline" with minimal padding

website_summaries.verdict: Designed to be an ultra-breathable cot, this extremely popular dog bed keeps your pet feeling cool at an affordable price.
pros: Customers enjoy how well the knitted-fabric supports air flow
Cot resistant to fleas, mites, mildew, and mold
Powder-coated steel frame designed to hold up under even the heaviest dogs
cons: Plastic connectors on the legs have a tendency to break

website_summaries.verdict: A simple, yet well made design that appeals to all pets.
pros: Aluminum bars create a solid, reliable foundation for pets of all sizes
The bed can be slept on as-is, or used as a base for your pet's favorite soft blanket or pillow
The bed can be used both indoors and outdoors
A simple wash with a hose is all you need to clean the Coolaroo bed
The mesh base is smooth, and replacement mesh can be purchased for a low cost
cons: Wait until the end to tighten bolts, or you will run into multiple assembly problems

customer_reviews.title: Pigs love it too!
customer_reviews.text: These beds are amazing. We have 3 pigs and 3 dogs sharing 4 beds. Two pigs usually sleep on one together. They love them! A sharp hoof poked through the material...we couldn't break it to her that she's a little overweight. Our fault. But the replacement covers are only $9! Love!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley N. Gary

customer_reviews.title: Making them with plastic frome connectors now.  Broke within a week.
customer_reviews.text: These have been made cheaper since my last order. They now have plastic connectors where the frame goes together. One of the connectors broke within a week. So the bed is useless now. I have several of these and prior to this last one the frames were all metal and never caused a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Sehorne

customer_reviews.title: Such an amazing value!!
customer_reviews.text: This bed has exceed my expectations in every way. So affordable and has shown zero signs of wear after being left out in the California sun and heat for over 9 months! Not to mention a fat little English bulldog treating it more like a trampoline than an actual bed haha
customer_reviews.author: nikki goodman

customer_reviews.title: Awful Assembly
customer_reviews.text: I'm a handy person. I put stuff together all the time. This was awful. It wasn't awful because it was complicated, it was awful because of the parts provided. The holes in the bars aren't large enough to accommodate the screws that the give you. They only fit in up to a certain point. I ended up stripping several of the screws in my attempt to put this thing together. This was without actually assembling it, this was simply screwing the bolt into the hole in the cross bar to try and make the hole wide enough. I included a photo of about how far it would actually make it in.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Well Made.
customer_reviews.text: Great product and well made. I have two Jack Russell Terriers and they pull and chew on everything as long as they can get a grip on it. They started to pull/chew on the fabric immediately. Therefore, I made one small modification to the pet bed by adding plastic corners to cover the exposed ends. Now my dogs can't get a solid grip on the fabric anywhere and which prevents them from pulling and chewing it up. Works great ... see pictures. The corners are made from 5 inch stiff plastic landscape edging. I just used some small sheet metal screws to anchor them to the pet bed frame.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Dog Approved
customer_reviews.text: No more stinky, puked on squishy beds that I can't clean. It took a couple days for my dogs to fully accept something new in their bed areas but using some stinky dog towels made full acceptance happen. And keeps the diggers from tearing through the knitted fabric. Since my medium to large dogs like to flop out and stretch out, I opted for the bed size large.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: My 135lb great dane mix loves this bed
customer_reviews.text: My 135lb great dane mix loves this bed, this is the large which could be a lil bigger for him but again if it was any bigger it would not fit in my house! He has chewed all his beds and he is not interested in chewing this one...I think i have found a keeper, i read the other reviews that said it was hard to put together, i did what everyone else said and did not tighten the bolts until it was all assembled, i am a 28 year female and it took me 5 mins to put together, and cleary it holds well for my huge puppy!
customer_reviews.author: jocelyn laursen

customer_reviews.title: These beds are great. My husband made wood bunk beds for our ...
customer_reviews.text: These beds are great. My husband made wood bunk beds for our beagles using two of these beds. The pups love them and they are durable.
customer_reviews.author: Beagle Mom

customer_reviews.title: Best beds for @ $25.
customer_reviews.text: Best dog beds for @ $25. And replacement fabric is @ $12. Easy to wash. I just hose them down and spray a tide mixed with water and rinse. My one dog is hard on the bed, but replacing $12 of fabric every year is worth it. I actually fit them in 4' dog kennels and they love it. The dogs are a little skeptical at first, but they'll love it.
customer_reviews.author: W. Wiler

customer_reviews.title: Great concept. Horrible material.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a total of 4 beds, one large, 3 medium. Within a week they were full of tears and the material the "mattress" is made of breaks down at a rapid rate. Every time a dog uses the bed a ton of dust is left beneath it. Daily sweeping is required. I'm not sure what exactly the material is but my guess would be recycled plastic grocery bags. Total junk. Also, the mattress is a tad bit too small for the frame causing great frustration while assembling. Great concept, horrible material. (All 4 beds were used indoors only.) Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: CCC

customer_reviews.title: FIrst time, bad experience with product on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: So far, AWFUL EXPERIENCE!! I received this A couple days ago. Started to assemble it, and one of the screws (Though, going in, straight) stopped. When I tried to remove it, and try again, IT WOULDN'T COME BACK OUT!! I cannot screw it IN MORE, IT WON'T COME OUT!! IT IS STUCK!! Now, I have these two rods, hanging onto each other, CAN'T DO ANYTHING WITH THEM!! This is ridiculous!! I can't even get it UNDONE, to SHIP BACK!!! Now, I must go BUY A BOX, big enough to fit, and return this!! AWFUL
customer_reviews.author: wyle528

customer_reviews.title: Cat Naps
customer_reviews.text: I like for my outdoor cats to be able to get up off of the ground when sleeping or resting. I added clip on umbrellas to provide shelter. The instructional video was most helpful in putting the beds together, especially the part about needing to place your knee/leg on one side while screwing in the legs (otherwise the bed would flip up/twist while trying to assemble it. This information was not in the printed directions. Took more time than expected to assemble, but very pleased with end results.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overrated and cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Pros: pretty easy to assemble Cons: the fabric is extremely scratchy and rough on areas with less fur, like elbows. She dug a hole through the fabric in under 6 hours while I was out with the kids one day. The frame is very flimsy and torques at all the connections when you pick it up to move it, bending into crazy shapes that you have to fix when you set it down again. I would not consider this portable because of the bending issue and because the legs don't fold up (yeah, it bends but does not fold), it would be really awkward to take along on a camping trip or other car trip.
customer_reviews.author: G Phelps

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: As much as I would like to, I CANNOT rate this higher than two stars. Pros: Cheap, decently high quality material, Dog loves it. Cons: PUTTING IT TOGETHER. It is nigh impossible to put it together with only one person. The construction is SO TAUGHT that it causes the frame to warp without any weight on the frame which makes it OUTRAGEOUSLY difficult to move around and to work with and takes far far far far far far far too much effort to put together. I say this without exaggeration, if my dog didn't love this bed I would burn it to make myself feel better.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Queal

customer_reviews.title: Bed too small for frame...Is there a hidden camera?
customer_reviews.text: I'll start off with the positives...The frame seems very sturdy, until the plastic washers will break. My dog loved it and fell asleep,cute as can be on it, even in its sagging and unconnected state. NOW, on to the downside.....It's as if they packed a large frame and then grabbed a medium cover. I can hear the laughter from the packaging plant now. I put things together just fine. There is absolutely NO way this cover fits the frame. The fun part is HOW LONG I TRIED b4 I GAVE IN to that truth. The packagers should include a camera for their viewing pleasure of assembly attempts. Returned. Trying another company, though, every bed seems to have similar issues.
customer_reviews.author: Preston

customer_reviews.title: Bed nice, but hard to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Arrived yesterday. Insanely hard to assemble. 3 legs easy. 4th leg next to impossible as tension makes it extremely difficult to line up screw hole with screw. (Even with other screws only partly tightened). Took 5 minutes to assemble 3/4ths of the way, and another 45 minutes of struggle and sweat to attach remaining leg! Seems nice when assembled, however. Sometimes warps when you pick it up to move it, but flattens easily with push when you set it down. My dog is an aggressive chewer, but she is afraid of this bed at the moment (doesn't like new things), so it remains to be seen how durable and useful this will be for us. Will update review as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Harris

customer_reviews.title: Amazing and sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: So happy a coworker recommended this for our dogs. Purchased our first one 4 years ago, then a second smaller one for our cats. The one for our dogs stays outside and it has held up very well for 4 years, now we're finally buying a second large one for our outdoor patio. Our newest pup (French Bulldog) just loves it! He stays cool and rolls around on it while we're sitting outside. He also took over the cat's Coolaroo and just snoozes on that one most of the day while I'm working hard to make sure we can spoil him like he deserves!
customer_reviews.author: C. Sisbarro

customer_reviews.title: Simple. Quality. Works for 130lb Dane
customer_reviews.text: Great bed. I was a little nervous about the 130lb Dane fitting on the bed and her paws punching through the 'mesh'. To my surprise. She fits on it well and walks on it with out tearing the material. My only complaint is the mesh is for lack of better words plasticky which makes a little noise when the dogs is moving on it. Not really a big deal. I probably should put a soft thin dog bed on top. The reason I purchased this vs a traditional bed is the dog kept tearing up the big fluffy and expensive memory foam beds.
customer_reviews.author: Adam D

customer_reviews.title: My Great Danes Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 Great Danes and they all LOVE this. We just bought another one to put outside by the pool. It is Great Dane approved!!!
customer_reviews.author: Toni G

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love it.
customer_reviews.text: I don't even know why my dog loves these so much. We have a 75lb lab it's the perfect size. She liked it so much at a friends house we bought for at home. I'm on my 3rd one, they last us about 2 years which is pretty good for the price. When we got the first one our dog was going nuts while I was putting it together and started using it as soon as I got it outside. It works great for helping wet dogs dry fast. Ours runs between the pool and coolaroo all day during the summer. Best dog product out there!
customer_reviews.author: Spacetrucker

customer_reviews.title: Great bed for dogs who tend to get hot
customer_reviews.text: My lab-mix loved it and it wasn't hard to get her to enjoy it; I led her to it with food so she would step on it. The next time I came home from work, she was enjoying it. I would actually rate it at 4 1/2 stars if I could because it was very tough to put together. My dog is 65-70lbs and I ordered a large; the picture shows how she fits on it.
customer_reviews.author: Wandering Colorado Girl

customer_reviews.title: Good Luck Assembling!
customer_reviews.text: Once assembled they are great. But the machining is so rough, good luck getting the screws and washers on! Takes at least 2 people a frustrating half hour at least. I think the one I bought last year assembled easier. If I wanted to ruin my day I can think of more fun ways. Amazon should pay me for this much time & hard work. This bed could easily be designed with fold down legs but that would maybe cut into the profit margin. So important. I’m not happy, can you tell?
customer_reviews.author: Frieda

customer_reviews.title: Outdoors The More!
customer_reviews.text: Have you a dog breed that wants to be outside but you don't want your precious paws to be resting on hot concrete or something worse? Here is a picture of our Heidi Klum Young, our super model Shaefer Hund, relaxing on her dog bed waiting for her mistress to toss the ball....over...and over...and over... again. The bed has a trick to assemble. Watch the YouTube video to get the hint or you'll be frustrated with the Allen Wrench. Also, The sun hasn't deteriorated the fabric. Thank you, Koolaroo! It's easy to hose down and you bet your hot pup will find the damp bed to be a spa treatment. So, get this. Great Price! Get this now!
customer_reviews.author: Exospice

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Basics version of this is much better
customer_reviews.text: This coolaroo hammock bed is awful. My dog used the amazon basics version of this for close to 2 years and it finally ripped cause he started scratching at it. I got this coolaroo one cause it was cheaper than buying the amazon replacement hammocks at the time. I regret it. The hammock on this coolaroo one is significantly thinner, it's almost see through. It feels like really thin, cheap, plastic tarp where the amazon one felt like thick, dense, nylon threading. I highly recommend just spending the extra few dollars and getting the amazon one. stay away from this cheap thing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy Peasy Assembly and Large Enough
customer_reviews.text: The first image is my 80-pound rescue and the second is my 60-pound American Pit Bull Terrier. The Pit loves it! My pretty, sweet mutt hardly uses hers but it holds her without sinking to the floor. It is easy to assemble, plenty large enough for my babies, and it doesn't stick out like a sore thumb. I'm very pleased with this purchase. Oh, bonus! The Pit has destroyed everything from pillows and blankets to his crate (when I was house breaking him). He has tried to chew this but has yet to be able to get a satisfying grip. Now we wait. I think the texture isn't to his liking as far as chewing goes.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda McCloud

customer_reviews.title: WTF?
customer_reviews.text: I got this really quickly which is great but LITERALLY the pieces DO NOT align. So I put in the request to get a replacement thinking maybe I just got a dud. The second one came just as quickly HOWEVER THEY STILL DON'T ALIGN. What is the heck is going on?! I have never had any issues with things I have purchased off Amazon but this is on another level. I have put so many things together so I know how to assemble products. I used all of my strength to try to stretch the mat but its just not working. I am returning!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Own two sizes
customer_reviews.text: I bought a large brown bed several years ago for our older Weimaraner who liked to lay in the sun. The fabric has held up very well though the connections are beginning to rust. I recently purchased the medium for our beagle. I would suggest measuring your dog when they are sprawled out with legs to the side, not curled up. The length of the mesh is different than overall dimension with the legs. The measurements listed are accurate. The product came fast, in a small box, and was easy to assemble. The fabric on the new brown bed is slightly different and the pattern runs the opposite direction so they don't actually match. Overall love the beds.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: It would be best to have 2 people put this together because it is a bit difficult, but it can be done alone. My little dog loves this but she prefers to have a blanket or a towel covering the mesh which defeats the purpose of the air flow. She lays on it every day and seems to like it because she stopped moving to the floor all the time. I can't rate the chew proof because she doesn't chew but I would assume that the mesh can be chewed or ripped if your dog was determined to destroy it. I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Great tension bed but needs 2 ppl to put together...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, had for about 2 months now. Only bed that my dog hasn’t chewed up or ruined. Took a little bit for him to get use to but now he sleeps on it and always jumping on and off of it. It’s firm at first but it does loosen up. My pup has put a few snags with his teeth due to trying to bite the mesh 😑 Does require 2 ppl to build because of the tension. I did do it myself but it took me about 40mins lol My lab is about 80lbs and the large size is big enough for him. He has lots of space
customer_reviews.author: Iza M.

customer_reviews.title: Stitching coming undone after a few days.
customer_reviews.text: It's nice but not sure if my dog is too heavy. I purchased the large bed for my dog that is 80lbs. She seems to like it but the stitching on the corner didn't last. The stitching is ripping after only a few days. Maybe not a good bed for heavy dog. I inspected it, thinking she was responsible for it but it doesn't seem so.
customer_reviews.author: favian gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy When on Ground
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice elevated trainer pad for dogs. We are using this to train our puppy place. This is where our dog lab will go whenever we need him to be calm somewhere, such as when someone knocks on our door. This is perfect for that. I suppose it could be a bed, but our dogs like softer places to lay. The only downside has to do with the design. Even though sturdy if you pick up it will flex one way or other. However, when placed on ground where it will be most of the time it sits nice and square. Assembly was not problem, but I don't shy away from assembling anything from Ikea furniture to sheds.
customer_reviews.author: ReviewLP

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: My family bought this to go camping with our dogs. We have a 35ish pound Corgi and 10ish pound Toy Australian Shepard. They both fit on the bed perfectly together. The weight limit on the medium is 75 lbs, so they don't exceed that. And I would watch the weight limit, it's not the strongest of materials. I would have liked a bit more stronger of a stretch, if my dogs don't use constantly, they become weary of the bed and I have to train them to use it all over again. It isn't difficult, but it's a bit of a process with them.
customer_reviews.author: JonasGeek

customer_reviews.title: This company is not about integrity.
customer_reviews.text: I was unable to put this bed together because one of the screws was faulty and would not thread into the hole. It also appeared that the cover itself was too small. I spoke to Jake who said that the size of the the bed was fine and that he would send replacement screws. He did not hit any time apologize for my inconvenience or his company's error. I received the screws today. They are the wrong screws. They are roughly three-quarters of an inch too short and they have a completely different head then the original screws. I would like them to explain this but guess who's closed today. This bed is going back.
customer_reviews.author: L. Ellen

customer_reviews.title: My pup knew it was his bed from the moment we set it up
customer_reviews.text: My dog (border collie, blue healer mix) has never liked another dog bed since he outgrew his puppy bed. He also gets hot quite easily so I thought I would give this a try, especially at such a reasonable price. He knew right away that it was his bed and we also placed it over a floor vent for extra cooling. His nails have punctured the bed in 1 or 2 spots but it doesn't look like it will get worse with normal use. Assembly was simple but did need two people for the final stretching step. I am glad to have a place that he knows is his own!
customer_reviews.author: magmel

customer_reviews.title: Sami loves it, so I love it.
customer_reviews.text: The pics are from 10 minutes after I finished putting the bed together. My 12 week old border collie got the ‘zoomies’ for the first time, then relaxed with ALL her bones. Update. My now 4 month old pup still loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris James

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but size was much larger than quoted in the description!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this item in a size small. I was expecting a pet bed that was 21 inches long that I could put in front of the storm door so that my cat could lie down while watching the wildlife outside, instead of having to sit up straight in order to see over the bottom of the door. When assembled, this measured almost 36 inches long, and was too big to use in space I had intended it for. I returned it about a week ago, and I see that no one has gone in to correct the measurements. Had it not been so large, I would have kept it. It went together nicely, and was sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Gail M

customer_reviews.title: Small Size Cot
customer_reviews.text: I was not real sure what size to buy my dog. So, I measured my dog laying down lengthwise to give me a size of the length of the sleeping area he would need. Takes two people to install the pipes...make sure one person has lots of muscles to screw in that last pipe. Also, YouTube has a video on how to install the cot. My dog is about 16-20 pounds. See picture. Sleeping area is 21" × 27 1/2". If you had a blanket on the cot you can take full advantage to all this space. Both my dogs jumped right on the cot wihout problems. Perfect size, plenty of stretching room.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Pre-assembly warning
customer_reviews.text: I just finished assembling two of these beds, so the dogs have not tried them out. However, I feel that future buyers should know that also included in the assembly of these beds are a few "wtfs", "Jesus Christs" and a call to Superman for his damn super human strength, followed by a nap to calm yourself down, because by the time you are finished, you are going to hate Allen and his damn wrench. And add ten extra minutes to assembly as you will these these minutes to either cry uncontrollably or laugh hysterically, alternatively. So, considered yourself pre-assembly warned. Other than that, they look good.
customer_reviews.author: Vina J. Guzman

customer_reviews.title: Assembly not so easy
customer_reviews.text: My relatives have this for their dog and really liked it. When arrived looked like it would be snap to put together. First side had no problem. Second side was very difficult. Took too people over 30 minutes. Figured out holes for screws where not lined up correctly so we had to have one person pull while the other screwed in the second side. Even now there is one screw that will not go all the way in and I'm pretty sure the screw will be stripped if we try to take it out and put a new pad on. When storing the bed also sits up on one side since the two crossbars are not aligned right.
customer_reviews.author: Jalene Bowersmith

customer_reviews.title: Po tested and Po approved
customer_reviews.text: Po is our 90 lb pitt/lab mix. Bought this for his kennel and he took to it instantly! Had wanted something big enough, that he could not destuff (pillows/beds) that would get him off the ground in Georgia heat. Putting it together took almost no effort - only issue was one hole was not properly drilled but in 15 second s- hubs fixed that with his cordless drill. I love that replacement covers are available instead of having to replace entire bed! The material is an odd texture - allows for air circulation and drainage if wet down with water hose or Po (!) We bought the large - fits him perfectly with room to expand!
customer_reviews.author: Sandi Voyles

customer_reviews.title: The small coolaroo is not so cool
customer_reviews.text: I get that the tension is “supposed” to keep the four legs on the ground, but one leg just keeps popping up no matter what I do, thereby making it scary for my dog to climb on it. At this time he won’t even get near it. I also have the large coolaroo and the assembly was fine and I had no problems with all floor legs staying on the ground. Perhaps the cover for the small one was made too tight. I can not recommend this product. If the manufacturer has a solution, I would be willing to listen. Until then, don’t waste your time or money. Maybe Goodwill will take it.
customer_reviews.author: Frugalman

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: I was sent a box that appeared to have been previously opened. If that was the only problem, I could have lived with it so long as everything worked! Alas. The holes drilled into the legs did not match up, which made assembling the bed impossible. (I have another Coolaroo bed that I assembled a few months ago, so I had some idea of what to expect.) There was no rubberized tip at the end of the bars, which was also very strange. It won't be easy to send back, and I'm extremely disappointed. A waste of time and money. I ordered directly from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: chouette

customer_reviews.title: SORRY PURCHASE
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased these beds for various dogs for years. Right now have 4 for my Boston Terriers. Bought the large for my daughter's mastiff puppy, delivered and put together on June 11, and the metal support has already bent. It has been rigged so that she can use it for the time being but if you are considering one of these beds, look to another manufacturer. (We used to have 6 mastiffs and they all had these elevated beds....it is not because she is a large dog since she still is a puppy). VERY UNHAPPY. Item shows as no longer available....wonder why???
customer_reviews.author: Happy Hills

customer_reviews.title: Love these doggy beds!
customer_reviews.text: We have purchased one of these beds for all 4 of our dogs. The are excellent for the back yard or to take camping. We add the orthopedic pillow to them and our dogs sleep in style. The nice part is that the bed gets the doggy up off the ground and this is especially good for dogs who suffer from arthritis and from preventing it in big dogs. We have had this type of bed for our dogs for over 20 years since they first started being made.
customer_reviews.author: William E. Henry Jr.

customer_reviews.title: If your dog’s been boarded or sheltered it’ll be familiar
customer_reviews.text: Size and height are excellent for air circulation; our dog won’t be laying directly on a hot deck this summer. I can tip it up and it’ll stand stably on its side so we can clean under it or just have it out of our way. The only downside is that water (rain or sprinklers) puddles on the surface instead of running through the fabric so we dump it when we notice it.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny the Occasional Reader

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative bed
customer_reviews.text: This bed is good to keep dogs off of the ground and let air circulate underneath. Keeps dog cool and comfortable. Easy to clean and move around. It is a bit of a tripping hazard with the legs sticking out. The fabric gives just enough for comfort and form shaping without sagging. We also use it to hold all dogs toys when they are in their crates at night or when guests are over. I now have two and use one outside by the pool so dog doesnt have to lay on the concrete and helps keep him cool. Recommend getting the largest size if you have a larger/big dog.
customer_reviews.author: JaxFL

customer_reviews.title: The frame continues to loosen
customer_reviews.text: I do not like that the framing continues to loosen at the fastener locations. The metal tubing surfaces are not matched at these areas so the frame lacks rigidity and continues to sway. I have to tighten the screws several times a week. This movement is not likely to prevent older, slow moving, animals that are cautious due to the uncontrolled movement. The mesh material is looser than other brands and this design might prove cooler in the summer months but the design might not last for long. The underside of the fabric almost touches the ground if my 65-pound hound gets onto the bed.
customer_reviews.author: Skull

customer_reviews.title: Small is perfect for Boston's
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the medium first because of the reviews. It was way too big. I retuned it for a small and it's perfect! I love it can be hosed off and it doesn't smell like dog! For anyone looking for one of these beds for a Boston Terrier, small is the way to go. I'm attaching photos of how Wilson fits on it, he loves it!!
customer_reviews.author: PJSmith

customer_reviews.title: Big Dogs, size large, Love Love LOVE!
customer_reviews.text: We started out ordering one (large nutmeg) bed to see how it fit our boys. Wasn't sure if we could get away with the large... but wanted to so we could get the nutmeg color. It was perfect, so we ordered a second. Very pleased with the quality and durability of the beds. We have an 80# Plott Hound/Boxer and a 100# Rottweiler/Cattle Dog. They can even lay together on one bed! (Picture included) We've used them outside all summer and they still look like new. We'll be bringing them in for the boys to enjoy during the winter.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Frayer

customer_reviews.title: Weak frame
customer_reviews.text: This bed... has been a thorn in my side since I took it out of the box. It constantly falls apart, even after my husband used his super strength (mechanic) to tighten all the screws. Our puppy started to chew the fabric the first day we had it! When she goes to lay down on it, the frame becomes distorted and one leg raises up into the air. That leg then gets stuck on the kennel fence and it just gets worse every time she tries to use it. I would not recommend this, even if the price was more reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Eldood

customer_reviews.title: Great Bed
customer_reviews.text: At first I was frustrated trying to put it together by myself, then I watched a YouTube video and finally accomplished the task. I ordered the Large and was pleasantly surprised that it was bigger than I thought it would be. I bought this for my 13 year old lab who is slowing down, and has a difficult time. I have stairs for the couch that he has finally mastered and uses regularly. He hasn't quite taken to the elevated bed yet. We are working on it. I love it, it is easy to clean, keeps him cooler than his other bed is easy to move around. Hope he takes too it soon. I do recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Win, almost.
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love it. I'm not handy and didn't have much of an issue putting it together. It dries easy and is awesome for our hot Texas weather. I've had it less that 24 hours, have three adult dogs who have taken to this bed easily. The biggest is right at 50 pounds, so no where near the limit this bed should hold, and yet... It's ripped. I have no answers as to how or why this happened, but it did. And I'm disappointed. The absolute worst cloth outdoor dog beds last at least a few months, this one is already ripped. And for the record, my dogs are indoors much of the time. This bed should not have ripped.
customer_reviews.author: D. K. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this item because it was a lower price from the original new product. Apparently it was a return item to Amazon because there were shipping labels peeled off the box. It’s true that the item was in original condition but it was missing the bolts and screws to connect the legs and support rails. Rather than losing the time to return the item and waiting for a new delivery I just went to the hardware store and bought the connecting bolts that I needed. It’s inconvenient and added cost and it irritating but the product is functional.
customer_reviews.author: CRAIG MUROBAYASHI

customer_reviews.title: Great dog beds
customer_reviews.text: Great value for these beds. My goldens love them. My dogs are ALWAYS muddy, so I got the brown color and it is perfect. And I just sweep under after where all the dirt falls through (it’s almost like giving them a dry bath). These are lightweight yet sturdy. Literally the worst problem is I have to watch my cats because the material is preferable for scratching 😂. Great for summertime in the south- my dogs prefer my hard floor because it is cool, but these beds provide a bit of relief while still being way cooler than their dog beds.
customer_reviews.author: M. Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Once assembled, it's great
customer_reviews.text: Overall, a great product. However - and this is a theme in the comments - when assembling, it becomes very difficult to complete because of the tension needed in the fabric. It seems the fabric is not cut or sewn square. This creates a pretty big problem with the last screw for the frame has to be inserted and tightened. Many buyers were disappointed the frame was twisted when they finished assembling. This is the result of the uneven fabric issue. However, once it's done, when it is flattened out on the floor, it stays that way. All's well that ends well. The dog likes it, so ... onward.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Wojewidka

customer_reviews.title: Are you strong enough?
customer_reviews.text: We bought two Coolaroo beds when we were in our 40s. I'm a small woman and needed my husband's help on the last screw--a major stretching of the fabric. We bought fabric replacements in our 50s. Very difficult, but we got the beds back together. I bought one whole new bed now when we are in our 60s. We can't get the bed together. Making the fabric section 1/2 to 1 inch longer would probably cure the problem. Now we have to ask a younger neighbor or call a handyman to help us. Not thrilling. We are pretty able bodied and I weight train, though admittedly the weights are pretty light.
customer_reviews.author: First, a reader

customer_reviews.title: Bigger than expected
customer_reviews.text: I got a medium for my 9mo old pug – he's about 17-18lbs. I think we would've been okay with a small (see pic). It's not his favorite place to sleep on just yet but I like how it's ventilated, which will be perfect when it gets much hotter in the coming months. The frame does move quite easily so u have to pick it up properly with both hands. I can't comment on the setup itself cause I had the bf put it together for me.
customer_reviews.author: blustarhi

customer_reviews.title: Buy this bed now for your dog!
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect outdoor dog bed! It is also massive so both of my dogs can lay on it, which almost never happens lol. It's very easy to clean by just spraying it down with the hose and there is no getting mad at the dogs when you just bath them and they go lay on this vs the patio furniture! It was kind of a pain to put together but once together, best ever! My dogs are obsessed with this bed with how hot it is and even my little dog who never goes outside without me will just go outside on her own just to lay on this bed!
customer_reviews.author: Aly

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy enough to carry a 110 lb dog
customer_reviews.text: We bought this bed when our dog was no longer able to walk. We needed something to get her off the floor and porous enough that when she peed she wasn't sitting in a puddle. This made clean up very easy. We could lift her off to get her cleaned, clean off the bed, and dispose of the waste without needing to do major cleaning. This bed was also sturdy enough to carry her on, she was a 110 lb Rottweiler. We could pick up the bed by the frame and carry her outside for some fresh air. This worked very well for us.
customer_reviews.author: Zen

customer_reviews.title: 1 star until I can get it assembled and even!!
customer_reviews.text: The instructions says it only takes 20 mins to assemble, but I can't get it to be even for the life of me! And I've working on it for well over 20 mins. I saw the video of another customer who also purchased the brunswick green option. I don't know if it's the brunswick green option that's having issues, like is the fabric cut shorter? The frame is fine when the fabric isn't on it. I really want this for my dog, but I have decided to return this.
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: If all else fails, try a different leg....
customer_reviews.text: Well made, good fabric, puppy loves it which is why it gets 5 stars. But take note of the most important sentence in the instructions which reads, "Your cover has been made with optimum tension, so you may require the assistance of another person to fit these last screws". In fact, after the lengthy wrestling match, I was able to do it myself. But here is a suggestion: If the last screw will not go in because of the "tension", I was successful after I chose a different screw to tighten the last leg on. They line up just differently enough that the opposite screw went in without binding. After all that, the dog is happy so I am happy.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: My pup is a 6 month old, 50 pound, Lab/Pitt mix. She is beautiful, charming, and a bit on the spoiled side. Those factors are important because it means she's selective and yet, she immediately fell in love with this bed. The color is, in my opinion, gorgeous. The shade of green matches the pines outside our patio. My son was able to put it together (using a power drill, fyi) in about 12 minutes. It holds my puppy's weight with slight dips when she steps on it but minimal dip when she's actually laying on it. Great value for the price and most of all, my little girl is happy!
customer_reviews.author: sdm12776

customer_reviews.title: They love it
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these to hopefully keep the dog off my couch. She still loves the couch but the cat and dog both sleep on this. I have a 60 lb. pit and an 18 lb. cat, and they use this every day/night. It was difficult putting it together, we needed 4 hands, but once it was together and on the floor, it was stable and we've had no issues since. Good product. I may buy another mesh for it so I can remove one and put on the other for wash day. The "opinion" asked about chew proof. Nope, an animal can definitely chew up material. But our animals don't gnaw on their bed, so we're good.
customer_reviews.author: MyOpinionMatters

customer_reviews.title: Great outdoor dog bed
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves it! Sticks and rocks get stuck in the wefts of the bed, it is eternally dirty and definitely not chew proof. It feels like a plastic wicker basket, not soft at all. I don’t understand why amazon is asking me if my outdoor dog bed is cleanable, chew proof or soft, but I figured I’d touch on that in my Review. It doesn’t retain water due to the material, which is great for keeping my dog off the wet grass My dog lies on it in the sun and likes to take his sticks there to chew, he hasn’t broken it yet, and that’s all I can ask for
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Durable, sturdy and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Our 9 mo old standard poodle puppy loves her bed but did do damage to a corner of the netting. However, it is very strong so she did not chew it all the way through. The good thing is that the replacement cost of the cover is very reasonable so I bought one in advance just in case! I also bought her two beds (one for upstairs and one for downstairs) so she chewed the one she plays on but when its night time, she curls up and sleeps like a baby! The other dogs love it too when she lets them share so ordered theirs as well.
customer_reviews.author: GcR

customer_reviews.title: Lasted one month
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a 6 month old Corso. He seemed to like it, but he's a big chewer. That said, he didn't chew the bed itself, but somehow managed to completely dismantle the frame. He destroys every bed he gets so I guess he likes lying on the floor. *shrugs* I honestly had a hard time getting the screws to tighten to where I really felt comfortable, so I'm not surprised they've come apart. Relaisticslly, you shouldn't need to constantly retighten the screws for the bed to last. But since it was less than $30, was worth a try. Welp.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So excited. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to receive this. My dog was just treated for heartworms and I needed something elevated that she could get up on without too much exertion. When opened the box and unfolded the mat, one of the corners is torn off! This natural is really tough. I can't imagine what happened to this for it to ship this way but I'm extremely disappointed and will be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany S

customer_reviews.title: Have patience durring assembly.
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty sturdy, has give in the mesh liner so it's not stiff. Assembling was a pain, the assembled product has a lot of tension. I got the one that supports up to 100lb. There's a picture review from someone showing it was warped, I bought this regardless of that review, and all I had to do was lay it on the ground and push everything flat- it warped time and time again sitting assembly and does every time the bed gets moved, but it always goes flat, it's just the tension. We have had zero problems with it, our dog weighs 70-ish lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Boggioni

customer_reviews.title: Pain to Put Together
customer_reviews.text: This was a pain to set up and the instructions were awful - just 4 pictures with labels. I got the idea, but it took me a few minutes of looking at everything before figuring everything out. Once you get to that last bar to connect it's quite difficult to get that to screw in - make sure to loosen other connectors as this makes it easier to lock it all in (pictures attached). However once it was completed my dogs really enjoyed it. We bought if for the outdoor patio. It might be a good idea to go a size up. Will update on any changes.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love it!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this dog bed so that we could get our dogs up off of the hardwood floor. It was a bit difficult to put together, but I had to work with it a little to get it straightened out. My dogs really love the bed - so much so that my husband ordered a second one! This size works perfect for both our medium size dogs and our larger size dog. It does take up a good bit of room though. My only complaint is that it gets loose over time and we have to tighten the screws so that it remains sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Strong Momma

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING WOULD RECOMMEND. very durable
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: 8/23/19 I received a new package and have been using it since. this cot is AMAZING. my dog loves it and lays on it constantly. she also vigorously plays with her friend on it. she weighs 60 lbs and her friend weighs 55 lbs. they rough house on it DAILY and both lay on it together all the time. we have the extra large. original review: the package i received was partially open and missing components, so i am not able to assemble the cot. i requested a replacement. i will update my review when i receive the replacement and assemble the cot.
customer_reviews.author: Janan Kline

customer_reviews.title: Think this is a great product for younger dogs and not really older dogs with any walking issues.
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves the height of it but can't get off of it well and needs help. I can see a dog under 10 doing well with this bed. I did put a piece of a memory foam mattress on there for added comfort and support. I feel the material is a bit rough on his skin. He's a bigger pitbull and of course not that hairy. I think a hairy dog would do better also on this bed.
customer_reviews.author: diva

customer_reviews.title: Threading in the end bar is malformed on 1st bed--replacement went together well.
customer_reviews.text: The securing screws do not match to the thread on one of the end bars. I carefully aligned the screw before applying pressure (it worked for the other three screw holes). After a puncture wound from the screwdriver into my hand, I decided more pressure would not fix the issue. I hope they can send a new end bar. I bought this because of the great reviews. *update* I requested a replacement and received it within 2 days. The replacement went together easily and UPS picked up my return. The dog likes the bed.
customer_reviews.author: K. Maunder

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a training tool to teach "place", "stay", etc. It's not as sturdy as the homemade pvc ones our dog trainer uses, it's hard to get the screws on the legs tight enough. But it works for what we need it for. And for the price, I couldn't pass it up. The material is a bit scratchy, so I would put a sheet or blanket down if you're using it as a dog bed. This size is perfect for our Border collie/Aussie mix who is 10 months old and ~38 lbs. Our senior 45 lb border collie/lab mix fits well on it too.
customer_reviews.author: Karah127

customer_reviews.title: Medium size plenty big for Border Collie mix
customer_reviews.text: You can't beat this for the price. Assembly was simple, though required an extra pair of hands to get the material stretched for the final connection. More than plenty of room for my Border Collie mix. I did add foam pipe wrap (what you use to prevent plumbing pipes from freezing in the winter) over the bar on the end that he likes to hang his head over so his chin isn't directly on the bar (because he's spoiled - I don't think he was bothered at all). We'll see how the fabric holds up with his nails.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer K

customer_reviews.title: Fits 109 lb Doberman
customer_reviews.text: I love this bed. My dog does not :( I spoiled my super stinky dog with an orthopedic foam bed that just absorbed the stank and made my entire house stink. I was SUPER excited to have found this one, but he is not a fan.. I think he's just spoiled. He prefers to lay on it when it has a blanket on it, so I think if I got one of those sheepskin cushions he would like it better. He doesn't like the metal edges, it's not comfortable to put his head on them. I was really concerned about size -- 109 lb Doberman -- but it fits him perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Mackenzie

customer_reviews.title: Good quality! Comfortable for dogs!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Our dog has torn up every bed or blanket we've every given him except this one. I also love that the fabric can actually be replaced just in case he does decided to rip it apart. I bought the size large and it is huge. Our dog is a lab/chow mix and only weighs about 70 pounds so I probably should have gotten the medium instead. He didn't seem to like the bed at first, until I put a fleece blanket over it as the fabric isn't the softest. I plan to put the bed outside in the summer for him to use while outside running around.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: difficult to assemble
customer_reviews.text: This is a good firm bed; really a frame with a covering to be honest. This was awful to assemble. The directions are vague. Once we finally got it assembled, the dog would not sleep on it so it was returned in our case. I do think this is a good option for those who are tired of soft beds that cannot be washed. This can be hosed off. I liked the fact it sat off the floor so air can circulate again, keeping odors at bay. While this didn't work for our dog, it may work well for someone else.
customer_reviews.author: Mallees mom

customer_reviews.title: Like a hammock for my doggies HUGE
customer_reviews.text: I can not attest to the chew proof since my dogs do not chew. I bought this for all my dogs to share, because sometimes they like to touch and sometimes they can’t deal with each other. It’s great at keeping them off the cold floor. Also, my eldest dog is 12 yrs senior. He loves this bed with its hammock-like support. Easy to move, easy to clean, robot vacuum goes under it perfectly. Assembly wasn’t “difficult”. Due to its size it required my son’s help to kind of finagle it around until it was completed. I snipped a hole in each corner of a crib sheet and slipped it over the bed 👍
customer_reviews.author: ncAmamzonWoman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect year round bed for my dogs.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought Coolaroo beds for my rescue dogs for 20 years. Just purchased a small size for my Sheltie. These cots are great. Exceptional value, easy assembly, unbeatable quality. In the summer the durable mesh cot offers comfortable, cool, breathable support; in winter we throw a plush pillow/dog bed on top - so much better than a bed that lays directly on the cold ground. Easy to clean - just hose them off occasionally. Just a couple of inches off the ground, so my senior dog has no trouble getting in or out. We keep them on our porch so our dogs have a comfortable spot when they’re outdoors. All our dogs thru the years love these Coolaroos.
customer_reviews.author: Dutch

customer_reviews.title: Awesome idea at a great price, royal pain to put together.
customer_reviews.text: So I really do like this and my dogs seems to as well 30 minutes after I got it put together. 1 star off bc one of the screws slots for the allen wrench to fit in was cut EXTREMELY shallow and would not stay in. Was a real blast to get that one tightened. Otherwise, all good. One of the features to rate is 'softness'...I would not call it soft, it provides a firm surface for the dog to lay on. However, you can easily put a towel, blanket, etc on top, though that will defeat the purpose of keeping your dog cool on warmer days.
customer_reviews.author: David B

customer_reviews.title: MY DOGS LOVE THESE!
customer_reviews.text: We've had Coolaroo cots for years, and no matter what size or breed of dog, they love this cot. Air circulates all around, easy to hose off, and no bugs can burrow in. Also good for the grass as it receives air, water and sunlight through this bed. When we had a larger bedroom, we put the dogs' beds on top of the Coolaroo for a nice elevated bed that was easier and cleaner on the carpet than just laying the bed on it. These last (if the corners aren't chewed) for years. Highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: L. Fisher

customer_reviews.title: The struggle is real
customer_reviews.text: Holy S#%$ is this thing hard to put together!! I tried by myself for 2 days on the floor trying to put this evil bed together. Literally using my feet to try and stretch one end while pulling the other. No problem with 3 sides & read reviews seen one said don't screw the 3 sides all the way before doing the fourth corner. Nope, still didn't work. Thankfully a big strong friend stopped by and he also struggled with my help, but we did FINALLY get it. My long haired cream golden retriever loves it. It does help keep him cool because he's always hot. It's the perfect size as well.
customer_reviews.author: Natalia E.

customer_reviews.title: Easiest to clean and no dog smell
customer_reviews.text: Most dog beds are awful, impossible to clean, stinky wastes of money. This one is great. Pros: -It has enough give that my dog seems comfortable -It keeps him cool on hot, humid days -I can sweep underneath -I can hose it down if/when it gets dirty -Visually more pleasing than most other dog beds Cons: -A little annoying to set up solo, but still took less than 20 minutes The fabric and stitching seems durable, I’ll update if any issues develop.
customer_reviews.author: Lily Koi

customer_reviews.title: Good bed. GREAT price. My dog doesn't care about either.
customer_reviews.text: Sooooooo...this is my second time purchasing an elevated bed for my large breed Pitbull. It's really just a preventative for future hip issues down the road. She obviously is a risk-taker because she refused to lay on one when she was 3 months old, and now that she 8 months old - she still has made it clear that it ain't happening. I kept it for a few weeks thinking that she'd come around, but she avoids it like the plague so I returned it. That being said, it appears to be a great bed. It's sturdy, taught and was easy to assemble. I hope your dog enjoys it more than mine.
customer_reviews.author: R3AC3

customer_reviews.title: Misleading information
customer_reviews.text: My 85 lb. dog sinks into this so far that it is more like a warm nest than a cool platform. She doesn't like it at all and will squeeze herself into the space around it (it takes up a lot of space) and lie on the porch instead. Those of you who read the line of the description that says 51-75 lbs. will say, "well, what did you expect?" Unfortunately, I read the image that said "pets up to 100 lbs." and recommended it for labrador retrievers. Please learn from my mistake. Your dog will thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: Best 50$ I’ve spent on my husky!
customer_reviews.text: After spending so much money on different beds for my husky & him to continue to sleep on our hardwood floors or tiles I looked into an elevated beds thinking maybe it’s a cooling thing & took a chance on buying this bed & BOY I DID NOT REGRET IT. He literally wouldn’t get off of it to build the thing, after it was built he showed so much happiness towards his new bed. Now he won’t get off of it. 💙🙏🏻 No more sleeping on the hard ground! If you are hesitate to buying it, just go ahead and buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Alexus Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Great if assembled correctly
customer_reviews.text: Our dog loves these beds but they can be a real pain to set up. Have bought several these over the years and it's a 50/50 chance you will have an issue putting it together. You really have to put tension on the bars to get the screws in and I always get all 4 corners started and finger tight to line everything up but as you start tightening each corner one screw always seems to cross thread and jam up. Would give 5 star if assembly was a bit easier as this isnt the first time we came across this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Sean O

customer_reviews.title: 100% Pure cheap Crap
customer_reviews.text: Cheap crap. It is so stupidly made that it can not be assembled together. Only a few pieces, but the size of the bed does not match the size of its frame. Therefore, it can not be assembled at all. Waist of money and time. 100% crap!
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Defective product was sent
customer_reviews.text: The screws would not go into the bars. I tried for over an hour, even tried screwing them in directly without actually trying to put it together, but they still wouldn't go. After I spent an hour trying, I handed it to my husband and his friend who were also unable to get the screws to work. Now I have to decide whether I want to go through the hassle of returning this giant box, or if it's worth the trip to the hardware store to attempt fixing it.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love it.
customer_reviews.text: I just have gotten it, and my dogs love it. Since my dogs are all seniors, they do not chew so can not comment on that. From the looks of it, I would say it would be very easy to clean. Again since I had just gotten it a week ago, I can not say for certain. But it is in the house and I put a blanket on it as the dogs love blankets, but it is soft. I am not good at putting things together, but it took me 15 to 20 minutes to put it together. I looked at the directions once and that was it. It was really common sense on how to put it together.
customer_reviews.author: Milady2149

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: We just unboxed our bed and set it up for our sweet golden girl. We decided to go with a medium based off of previous reviews and she fits just fine! She's a little chunky (as you can see from the picture), but she seems to love it! I probably would have bought the large for her just so she could have some extra space to stretch out, but she fits just fine on the medium. She's always trying to sleep beside our couch to catch the draft, so I'm excited for her to have a cooler space of her own compared to her previous poly fill dog bed.
customer_reviews.author: Emily C.

customer_reviews.title: Dog Days of Summer must have bed
customer_reviews.text: I got this yesterday to help my dog stay cool when he sleeps. The cover is made of woven plastic, like recycled shopping bags. I thought it would be a softer material. The color is nice. I bought a replacement cover in a different color too. Assembly was easy until you get to the last screw to put in. *Make sure that the screws are not tightened until all screws are attached. It makes it easier to rotate the frame due to the cover not being stretchy. All in all it's a good price.
customer_reviews.author: D. Wininger

customer_reviews.title: Great bed for non-chewers!
customer_reviews.text: I am only giving this item 3 stars for chew proof because my puppy chewed through it in a matter of minutes but if you have dogs that aren’t into chewing I had this for at least a year with three other dogs before I got the puppy and it worked wonders in the heat! The great thing is that you can buy a new piece of fabric relatively cheap through Amazon to replace the original one after two years I was unable to get the rusted out screws to come off so I ended up having to buy a new bed frame.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Garber

customer_reviews.title: Works for a Giant
customer_reviews.text: I am about to order my third. I have a Giant Schnauzer that’s a little psychotic and 85 pounds. Before this cot, he considered all other beds to be oversized chew toys and/or subject to humping. This cot keeps him nice and cool (since he runs hot) and is a perfect spot for us to send him when he’s underfoot. He has broken two so far though by launching on and off it like a trampoline, and he’s also scratched holes the cot material. BUT one lasts about 6 months at a time which is so impressive compared to other products on the market. I 100% recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Rhodes

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, great product, poor execution
customer_reviews.text: The bed netting itself is amazing, the metal tubing and frame works well, The little bolts they provide to attach it all is a joke. The bolts are to small in diameter and way to small in length. As the dogs get on and off, it loses and unthreads the connection bolts. Plan on at least every other week having to tighten the whole bed back up. I added thread tape to mine which helps, but the bolts are still slightly to small in diameter and WAY to small in length. They need to redesign the connection and this is a 5 star product. Once those bolts bend or break the bed is now useless.
customer_reviews.author: Breanne O.

customer_reviews.title: My 9 month old GSD chewed an 8" hole about 14 hours after putting it together
customer_reviews.text: No joke. Just 14 hours. I watched her on my puppy cam just go to town on it and put a big hole in it. The product is ok though I saw dents in it from their paws within 6 hours. I have a couple 60# dogs and I bought the large. The size was fine. This is my first cot-style bed so maybe I hoped too much regarding the dents. Obviously being dug/chewed inside 14 hours is unacceptable and maybe my dogs simply can't have nice things. On to search for a better bed.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Harmon

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Dog Bed and Training “Place”
customer_reviews.text: My dog’s trainer uses these beds for training. She gives her a command to “Place” and my dog immediately jumps up on the bed and “Sits” and “Stays” until the release command is given. I brought one of her beds home to reinforce training. It worked so well that I bought my own. My dog goes to it immediately when given the “Place” command. She loves sitting on it and now sleeps on it too. The bed is very well made, sturdy and easy to assemble. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Bear

customer_reviews.title: Tough to assemble, but mostly solid
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because it seems well-made and Coolaroo sells replacement panels for the bed portion should I need them. The metal components and woven panel do seem well made but I found assembly difficult. I think it has to do with the taut fit of the woven panel, which makes it hard to align the last two holes to connect by screw. I had to muscle the pieces into alignment, and recommend that four hands are better than two for this job. The bed is pretty stable but some angled cross-bars would completely eliminate a tendency for the assembled frame to twist when all four feet are not on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: MindKTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: My Pits Love It!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this bed! My only complaint is that the fabric is kind of scratchy and needs something over it to be comfortable. However, my dogs like a blanket on their bed regardless so it wasn't such a big deal. They even have a pillow cause they're spoiled brats lol. They love this bed! They actually sleep in it instead of in MINE for a change! I have a 60 lb pit, a 35 lb puppy pit, as well as a small shihtzu and they all have plenty of room sleeping together in the large size.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

product_meta.title: The Original Elevated Pet Bed by Coolaroo
product_meta.description:
Size:Large| Color:Brunswick GreenKeep your pet healthy, safe, comfortable and cool with a deluxe Coolaroo Pet Bed. Perfect for dogs and cats of all sizes, breeds and weights, Coolaroo elevated Pet Beds help keep your animal cool by increasing air flow to its fur coat and comfortable by reducing pressure on its knees, hips, elbows and shoulders. 

Unlike low-quality imitations Coolaroo Pet Beds are available in five designer colors and feature high-quality, breathable, 100% recyclable lead- and phthalate-free fabric, which is GREENGAURD certified. This not only helps create a healthier environment for your four-legged friend, but is flea, mite, mold and mildew resistant for optimal health. 

Treat your pet to the rest it deserves with the original Coolaroo elevated Pet Bed.
feature_bullets: Off-the-ground design promotes and increases air flow on all sides of the bed, keeping your pet cool (Elevates pets more than 7 in. off the ground)
Suspended platform provides added comfort by creating low-impact areas to pressure points and joints (Offers almost 9 Sq. Ft. of bed space)
Fabric is made out of a breathable high density polyethylene (HDPE) fabric that helps eliminate hot spots
Flea, mite, mold and mildew resistant
Features a lightweight, yet strong powder-coated steel frame that is extremely durable for pets of all sizes
Portable design makes it ideal for both indoor and outdoor use
Available in three sizes (S, M and L)
100% recyclable lead- and phthalate-free fabric for a safer environment
